intro: Cyclostemon iwahigensis, commonly known as the Iwahig cyclostemon, is a rare flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Celastraceae and is characterized by its distinctive, pendulous inflorescences. The plant typically grows in lowland rainforests and is known for its small, yellowish-green flowers. It has thick, leathery leaves that are adapted to the humid, shaded environments of its habitat. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is of significant interest to botanists and conservationists.
